com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.xml.xpath
Interface XPathHelper

public interface XPathHelper

Helper methods to compile, evaluate, and cast the result of XPath expressions.

Unfortunately, the interfaces provided by Java are weak because they return null in many cases or do not correctly define pre- or post-conditions. You may consider this interface an improvement over the standard Java classes and methods.

To instantiate an instance of this class, see XPathHelperUtils.

Author:
Kevin Connor ARPE (kevinarpe@gmail.com)
See Also:
evaluate(String, Node, StandardQName, String), tryEvaluate(String, Node, StandardQName, String), XPathHelperUtils

Method Detail

evaluate

Object evaluate(String xpath,
                Node node,
                StandardQName qname,
                String xpathDescription)
                throws XPathHelperException
Compiles, evaluates, and casts the result of an XPath expression.

Parameters:
xpath - See example
node - Root node to search. May be Document reference.
qname - Expected result type
xpathDescription - Human-readable description of XPath, e.g., number of shared in index composition
Returns:
result of XPath expression. Never null and always can be cast to expected result type
Throws:
NullPointerException - if xpath, node, qname, or xpathDescription is null
XPathHelperException -
  • if xpath fails to compile
  • if evaluation result is null
  • if evaluation result cannot be cast to expected result type
See Also:
tryEvaluate(String, Node, StandardQName, String)

tryEvaluate

@Nullable
Object tryEvaluate(String xpath,
                            Node node,
                            StandardQName qname,
                            String xpathDescription)
This is a convenience method to call evaluate(String, Node, StandardQName, String) but returns null if exception thrown.
